questions.prompt: In a Binary Search Tree, where are values smaller than the root stored?
questions.explanation: BST property: all values in the left subtree are smaller than the node, and all values in the right subtree are larger.

questions.prompt: A node with no children in a tree is called a ____ node.
questions.explanation: Leaf nodes are the terminal nodes of a tree with no children.

questions.prompt: A binary tree can have at most two children per node.
questions.explanation: By definition, a binary tree has at most two children (left and right) per node.

questions.prompt: What is the average-case time complexity for searching in a balanced BST?
questions.explanation: In a balanced BST, each comparison eliminates half the remaining nodes, giving O(log n) search time.

questions.prompt: The height of a tree is:
options: Number of edges on the longest path from root to leaf
questions.explanation: Height is the number of edges on the longest path from root to any leaf node.

questions.prompt: Which traversal visits nodes in sorted order for a BST?
questions.explanation: Inorder traversal (left-root-right) of a BST visits nodes in ascending sorted order.

questions.prompt:
What is the preorder traversal of this tree?
        1
       / \
      2   3
     / \
    4   5
questions.explanation: Preorder visits root first, then recursively left subtree, then right: 1 -> 2 -> 4 -> 5 -> 3.
Level-order (BFS) traversal processes nodes level by level using a queue.

questions.prompt: What is the worst-case time complexity for BST operations when the tree is skewed (unbalanced)?
questions.explanation: A skewed BST degenerates into a linked list, making operations O(n) in the worst case.

questions.prompt:
What is the inorder traversal of this BST?
        5
       / \
      3   7
     / \
    2   4
questions.explanation: Inorder of BST gives sorted order: 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 7.

questions.prompt: Which tree type automatically maintains balance through rotations?
questions.explanation: AVL trees (and Red-Black trees) are self-balancing BSTs that perform rotations to maintain balance.

questions.prompt: The Lowest Common Ancestor (LCA) of two nodes is the deepest node that has both as descendants.
questions.explanation: LCA is the deepest (lowest) node in the tree that has both target nodes in its subtrees.

questions.prompt: To validate a BST, you should check:
questions.explanation: BST validation requires checking that ALL left subtree values are less than the node and ALL right subtree values are greater.

questions.prompt: A complete binary tree can be efficiently stored in an ____ using index formulas for parent/child.
questions.explanation: Complete binary trees map naturally to arrays: for node at index i, left child is 2i+1, right is 2i+2.

questions.prompt: What is the time complexity of finding the diameter (longest path) of a binary tree?
questions.explanation: Finding diameter requires visiting each node once to calculate heights, giving O(n) time.
